messageBody:
From: "Nicholas Lesiecki" <nick@...>
> What you describe sounds very similar to Cactus:
>
> http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/
>
> Have you looked at it?

Yes, and what I'm describing is far simpler than Cactus. There is no framework to speak of. Just a servlet that knows how to run a test suite and return the results as xml. For instance, you would pass this URL to your browser to run the tests in a remote app server.

http://localhost:8080/junit?classname=com.package.test.TestCase

It is very simple, but powerful. Since the test executes within the servlet container you can access all the facilities of the app server. We've also automated the startup and shutdown of the app server, so the entire test process is completely scripted. This makes it simple to plug the whole process into our cruise control build process.

Mike
